meanings.definition: To draw back or tense the body, as from pain or from a blow; start; flinch.
meanings.sent1: He winces when the dentist touches his sensitive tooth.
meanings.sent2: She winces slightly as she accidentally touches the hot pan.
meanings.sent3: The puppy winces playfully when tickled on its belly.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her past mistake makes her heart winces with regret.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise makes him winces in surprise.

meanings.definition: To shrink or start involuntarily, as in pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: The child winces at the sight of the scary movie.
meanings.sent2: He winces as the cold water touches his skin.
meanings.sent3: The cat winces comically when presented with a cucumber.
meanings.sent4: Her heart winces at the thought of losing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news makes him winces in disbelief.
